Content: Guessing most, if not all of batch 2 (and perhaps inclusive of the non-mini), were binned chips from batch 1. Would explain them removing the frequency adjustment in advanced settings

Author: bishop#9773
Content: Batch 2 is hit or miss. Some reports have the dropdown under advanced settings like Batch 1, others, like all the ones I received of Batch 2 just have "Balanced" under the advanced settings so runs at the default 500

Author: bishop#9773
Content: you can still get around it by manually changing the config file, but they don't OC as high as Batch 1, at least none of my Batch 2 have been able to hit 750

Author: SHossain#0007

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: @SHossain Use "Customize the fan speed percentage"

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
depends if they are 5500, 5600, or 6k RPM fans, really
edit: if 80% = 5k then they are 6250 RPM max

Author: wookie#7663
Content: I need some help. I've been mining for weeks/months non-stop, then I lost internet connection for a few minutes today. I shutdown the miner. After I re-established internet connection, I started up the miner again. But the miner just keeps crashing. I have a 1080ti and 1060 that I've been using for months with no problems. I use DSTM's CUDA miner on a pc and I mine on miningpools.cloud. Any help is appreciated.
